description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to allow changes to the ground floor rear roof design, ground floor front pitched roof design, ground and first floor front fenestration (including relocation of oriel window) and omission of ground floor side window pursuant to planning permission reference 180957FUL dated 28/02/2019 for 'Construction of a two storey detached dwelling with associated landscaping' (Part-Retrospective)
decision_conditions: Within nine (9) months from the date of this permission, the roof of the building shall be physically altered so that the development hereby permitted shall be fully completed in accordance with the following approved plans: ASB608_03D Proposed Plans; ASB608C_09 Proposed Site Layout; ASB608C_10 Proposed Elevations and ASB608_11 Proposed Block Plan, otherwise the planning permission will lapse.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: Location Plan, ASB608_01 Existing Plans; ASB608_02 Existing Elevations; ASB608_03D Proposed Plans; ASB608C_09 Proposed Site Layout and ASB608C_10 Proposed Elevations; ASB608_11 Proposed Block Plan.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Fenestration for the development shall be of dark grey aluminium construction and the front door of timber construction.  All other external materials to be used in the development, as labelled on the approved plans, shall comprise Scotch common bricks, white render and plain grey roof tiles; and timber fencing along the boundary with Claremont Road.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A to F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 and to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Furthermore, at no time shall the new house be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to first occupation of the new house, an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be installed and thereafter permanently retained

Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policies SI1 and SI2 of the London Plan (2021). | The proposed hard and soft landscaping layout to the front, side and back of the new house shall be carried out as shown on the approved plans prior to occupation of the development.  Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the pro-posed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the London Environment strategy (2018), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | At least 2 secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site.

Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with the London Plan (2021) policy T5. | Waste and recycling storage facilities to accommodate at least 2x 240L bins for recycling and non-recycling shall be provided and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
